sentences.cn: ...该部受到大肆宣传的新《星球大战》电影。

sentences.en: After all the ballyhoo, the film was a flop.
sentences.cn: 尽管炒作得厉害，这部电影还是不卖座。

sentences.en: The candidate's campaign was attended with too much ballyhoo.
sentences.cn: 对候选人的竞选宣传得太过分了.

sentences.en: The company was too conservative to indulge in ballyhoo in its advertising.
sentences.cn: 这公司太过保守以至于在它的广告上没办法尽情大举造势.

sentences.en: The power of red wine to counteract high cholesterol has been ballyhooed in the press.
sentences.cn: 红酒中和高胆固醇的功效在媒体上被夸大了。

sentences.en: They announced, amid much ballyhoo, that they had made a breakthrough.
sentences.cn: 在一通大吹大擂中，他们宣布自己取得了突破。

sentences.en: We find newspaper ballyhoo difficult to live with.
sentences.cn: 我们觉得难以容忍报纸的夸大宣传.

trans.tran_cn: 呐喊，喧闹，大吹大擂，假大空的宣传
trans.tran_en: when there is a lot of excitement or anger about something – used to show disapproval

If you say that something is ballyhooed, you mean that there is a lot of excitement about it and people are claiming that it is very good. You use this word especially when you think the thing is not as exciting or good as people say.
